speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Chapter Twelve: Batch Studio Review. After you run a scene, the studio enters a review phase. Every block that completed successfully shows a status icon on its left side. This icon tells you exactly what state the take is in.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: A yellow question mark means the take is a new draft, awaiting your decision. A green check mark means you have approved it. A red exclamation mark means you have rejected it. Blocks without any icon have not been generated yet.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: To review a take, click the Play button on its block to hear it. If you are satisfied, click the yellow question mark icon to approve. It turns green. If you are not satisfied, right-click the icon and select Reject. It turns red.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Before you start clicking through takes manually, there is a tool that can do the first pass for you. The Auto-Verify Batch checkbox sits in the toolbar next to Auto-Switch. Enable it before you run a scene, and the studio will audit every completed block automatically when generation finishes.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Auto-Verify runs two checks. First, it scans the audio for unnatural silences — any pause longer than two seconds is a sign of a hallucination or dropout. Second, it uses a speech recognition model to transcribe what was generated and compare it to your original script. A match below seventy-five percent is flagged. Hover over the yellow dot on any flagged block to read the exact reason.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: This approval system is what makes batch production efficient. When you click Run Scene again, the studio skips all green approved blocks and only regenerates the red rejected ones and any remaining pending blocks. You never waste time re-generating takes you already like.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Play All button in the toolbar plays every approved take in sequence, in order, giving you a preview of the entire assembled scene. This is a fast way to check the flow and pacing of a multi-voice production before exporting.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: When your scene is fully approved, click Export Approved in the toolbar. This saves all green-lit takes as numbered W A V files into a single folder of your choice. The files are named in sequence so they import cleanly into any D A W or video editor.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Please load Chapter Thirteen: The Transcript Helper, where we will look at the preparation tools for voice cloning source audio.
